fields.value: House Unpassed Legislation 1889, committee on military affairs - leave to withdraw, SC1/series 230, Petition of George D. Morandus

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Petition subject: Military service

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:25763599

Date of creation: (unknown)

Petition location: East Cambridge

Legislator, committee, or address that the petition was sent to: William S. Hixon, Chelsea; committee on military affairs

Selected signatures:

  1. George D. Morandus

Actions taken on dates: 1889-01-23,1889-01-24

Legislative action: Received in the House on January 23, 1889 and referred to the committee on military affairs and sent for concurrence and received in the Senate on January 24, 1889 and concurred

Total signatures: 1

Legislative action summary: Received, referred, sent, received, concurred

Males of color signatures: 1

Female only signatures: No

Identifications of signatories: late private "E" 38th U.S. Colored Troops, [males of color]

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Additional non-petition or unrelated documents available at archive: additional documents available

Additional archivist notes: drafted, Springfield, 1864, 1867, Cambridge, pension, moon blindness, disabilities, military aid, veteran, soldier, roll, Civil War, adjutant general, includes address

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: House Unpassed 1889, committee on military affairs - leave to withdraw
